reasoning:
1. Circle of Competence: Streaming video sits outside my circle. I understand railroads, insurance, consumer staples and simple industrials – not the economics of multi-billion-dollar content budgets and subscriber churn.
2. Competitive Moat: Netflix has scale, but it’s offset by massive content spend, fierce competition from Disney+, Prime and HBO. Its operating margin looks high on paper, but true pricing power is limited; subscribers switch services for a few dollars’ difference.
3. Management Quality: Reed Hastings and Ted Sarandos have built a great subscriber base, but capital allocation means negative owner earnings of $18/share last year. I like managers who generate free cash, not burn it in hopes of growth.
4. Financial Health and Consistency: ROE is –5.8%, ROIC –3.5%, debt/equity 0.67, earnings growth down 291% over 10 periods – that’s not the consistent fortress I seek.
5. Valuation vs. Intrinsic Value: A three-stage DCF yields a negative intrinsic value (–$210/share). Margin of safety is negative 140%. Paying up here invites permanent loss.
6. Long-Term Prospects and Red Flags: Content is a never-ending arms race. The industry’s economics change fast; technology and taste shift. I’d rather own See’s Candies or Coca-Cola, which will prosper regardless of who makes the next hot show.
7. Comparison to My Portfolio: I’d pick Coca-Cola’s brand, Apple’s ecosystem, Berkshire’s BNSF or GEICO over Netflix any day. There’s no meaningful margin of safety and too many uncertainties here.
In short, I’d pass – there’s no shame in saying “no” to a popular stock when it doesn’t meet our criteria.

fundamental_analysis.details: Weak ROE of -5.8%; High debt to equity ratio of 0.7; Strong operating margins; Current ratio data not available

consistency_analysis.details: Inconsistent earnings growth pattern; Total earnings growth of -291.0% over past 10 periods

moat_analysis.details: Inconsistent ROE: only 0/10 periods >15%; Decent operating margins (avg: 61.6%) suggest some competitive advantage

book_value_analysis.details: Good book value per share growth pattern

management_analysis.details: No significant new stock issuance detected; No or minimal dividends paid

details: Using three-stage DCF: Stage 1 (3.0%, 5y), Stage 2 (1.5%, 5y), Terminal (2.5%)
